target_text: "We aim for clean code. This mean maintainable code that confirms to well established guidelines. We also aim for sustainability of the design. This means the software design is able to cope with new requirements easily moving forward."

Role.Subject: Anthropology
Role.positionality: As a software developer pursuing a Master's in Anthropology with a focus on Economics, my background shapes my research goals to explore the intersection of technology and societal structures. I aim to understand how economic systems influence cultural practices and vice versa. However, I recognize my biases stemming from ethical and societal assumptions inherent in my technical background, which may color my interpretations of anthropological data. This positionality compels me to critically examine how my experiences and perspectives influence my analysis, ensuring that I remain aware of the complexities within the subjects I study and strive for a more nuanced understanding of the human experience.

codebook.justification: The phrase [maintainable code that confirms to well established guidelines] emphasizes the importance of code that can be easily understood and modified, reflecting best practices in software engineering.
The term [sustainability of the design] highlights the need for software that can adapt to future requirements, which is crucial for long-term project viability and user satisfaction.

The statement [able to cope with new requirements easily moving forward] underscores the necessity for flexibility in software design, allowing for iterative development and responsiveness to user needs.
